dlgPart.npc_text: “We have nothing to talk about,” says the Second Acolyte, his eyes betraying his nervousness.

dlgAnsw.text: “Funny, that’s what Meru said before the Gods struck him dead.”

dlgPart.npc_text: “I’m a pious man,” protests the Second Acolyte, suddenly pale.

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise]“So was Meru. The Gods demand our obedience in all things, big and small. That’s how they test our devotion. You see, anyone can claim to be a believer and say the right things. Not everyone can do the right thing.”

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]“I can!” proclaims the Second Acolyte, taking the bait.

dlgAnsw.text: “Then cast aside your ambitions and open your heart to the divine. Don’t you see what the Gods have in store for you? Are you that blind?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “No, I see it. I see it very clearly,” says the Second Acolyte, blinking his near-sighted eyes.

dlgAnsw.text: [streetwise][charisma]“It’s glorious, isn’t it, brother? Meru was tasked with preparing the world for the Gods’ return. I’m tasked with forging a mighty kingdom and conquering the Gods’ enemies, but it is your destiny that is the noblest and most wondrous of all, for this kingdom is for you!”

dlgPart.npc_text: [success]“For me?” gasps the Second Acolyte, his doubts long forgotten now.

dlgAnsw.text: “Who else? Of course, if you’d rather take my place and lead the faithful in battles, sleeping in tents and bathing in blood, I’d gladly switch places...”

dlgPart.npc_text: “But that’s not what the Gods want,” the Second Acolyte says quickly, displaying a rare insight into theological matters. “We must follow the divine plan, <brother/sister>. You have my vote.”
[failure]“You're wasting my time,” snaps the Second Acolyte. “I waited for years for this opportunity!”
